page.title: 02SHILLINGFORD-FARMING
page.content: THE AREA IS A MAJOR PRODUCER OF GRAIN CROPS.WHEAT,BARLEY AND MAIZE IS GROWN ON MOST OF THE FARMS.THE FIELDS ARE LARGE AND INTENSIVELY CULTIVATED.AT THIS TIME OF THE YEAR AS YOU WALK THROUGH THE AREA ONE CAN SEE A PATCHWORK OF GOLDEN YELLOW AND GREEN AS THE CROPS MOVE IN THE GENTLE BREEZE.HEDGEROWS DIVIDE THE FIELDS. THE GRAINS ARE SOLD FOR CASH PROFITS AND USED IN THE PRODUCTION OF FOOD PRODUCTS. SOME HIGH CLASSED GRAINS ARE GROWN FOR SEED.OBVIOUSLY THIS YIELDS A HIGHER CASH PROFIT. POTATOES,SWEEDS,CABBAGES AND ROOT CROPS ARE GROWN FOR SALE AS A FOOD CROP. FARMERS ARE TURNING TO OTHER TYPES OF CROPS TO INCREASE THEIR INCOME.SUN FLOWERS ARE GROWN FOR THEIR SEEDS AND LINSEED FOR IT'S OIL.
